newsitem.title: DUBAI: Third quake in two days jolts northeast Iran.
newsitem.headline: Third quake in two days jolts northeast Iran.

text.p: An earthquake measuring 5.4 on the Richter scale jolted northeastern Iran on Sunday, the third to shake the area in the past two days, the official news agency IRNA reported.
It said the quake hit the Birjand and Qaen area at 2:52 a.m. (2222 GMT on Saturday), but that there was no word on casualties or damage.
It said 475 aftershocks have hit the area since May 10, when a force 7.1 earthquake killed more than 1,560 people, injured 2,600 and left 50,000 homeless.
IRNA had on Saturday said two earthquakes measuring 5.9 and 4.9 on the Richter scale hit Birjand and Qaen within 24 hours. They left no casualties but damaged 60 houses.

Iran has been hit by at least three major earthquakes in the past year as well as scores of milder tremors and thousands of aftershocks that U.N. officials say have stretched the country's relief supplies to the limit.
Earthquakes measuring force four and above can cause widespread damage in a populated area.
